body_html:
hi @yenchanghsu

As you mentioned, I could not reproduce this on my machine either.

On the failing machine, can you give the output of:

cat /proc/cpuinfo

Next, can you please do the following.
Put this content into foo.py

import torch
source=torch.ones(91,91)
target=torch.zeros(91,91)
target.add_(source)
print(target)

Then, run the following commands and tell which ones are incorrect:

TH_NO_AVX2=1 python foo.py
TH_NO_AVX=1  python foo.py
TH_NO_SSE=1  python foo.py

body:
hi @yenchanghsu 

As you mentioned, I could not reproduce this on my machine either.

On the failing machine, can you give the output of:

```
cat /proc/cpuinfo
```

Next, can you please do the following.
Put this content into `foo.py`

```python
import torch
source=torch.ones(91,91)
target=torch.zeros(91,91)
target.add_(source)
print(target)
```

Then, run the following commands and tell which ones are incorrect:
```bash
TH_NO_AVX2=1 python foo.py
TH_NO_AVX=1  python foo.py
TH_NO_SSE=1  python foo.py
```
